item.title: XY Utilities v1.3.0.14
item.description:
Product: XY Utilities v1.3.0.14
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 08 Jan 2021 12:13:13 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Utilities for working with XY-data type (Cluster of 1D X and Y arrays).

Supported methods:
- <b>Arithmetic</b>: Add, Subtract, Multiply, Divide, Square
- <b>Array</b>: Sort, Reverse, Decimate, Decimate Array, Subset, Swap X and Y, Get X and Y, Append, Restrict X Range, Remove Outliers
- <b>Signal Processing</b>: Derivative, Average, Moving Average, Interpolate, Interpolate Parameter, Resample, FFT Spectrum, FFT Power Spectrum, Symmetrize
- <b>Filters</b>: Zero Phase Low Pass, Savitsky-Golay,
- <b>Conversion</b>: Waveform to XY, XY to Waveform, 2D to XY, XY to 2D

Release Notes: New Methods
- Linear Fit.vi: Linear LS Fit with upper and lower bounds
- Difference Quotient.vi: Returns average of forward and reverse difference quotient centered within window

Changes
- Interpolate now uses Interpolate 1D Array.vi instead of Interpolate.vi
- Change the way Derivative.vi automatically calculates "dx" from X-Array
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: XY Utilities v1.2.1.13
item.description:
Product: XY Utilities v1.2.1.13
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 05 Jan 2021 13:41:36 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Utilities for working with XY-data type (Cluster of 1D X and Y arrays).

Supported methods:
- <b>Arithmetic</b>: Add, Subtract, Multiply, Divide, Square
- <b>Array</b>: Sort, Reverse, Decimate, Decimate Array, Subset, Swap X and Y, Get X and Y, Append
- <b>Signal Processing</b>: Derivative, Average, Interpolate, Interpolate Parameter, Resample, FFT Spectrum, FFT Power Spectrum, Symmetrize, Shift Zero
- <b>Waveform Conversion</b>: Waveform to XY, XY to Waveform

Release Notes: New Methods
- XY to 2D.vi
- 2D to XY.vi

Changes
- Bug fixes in interpolation and determining dx
- Interpolate Parameter calls above methods
- Remove implied calls to Sort in some methods
- Derivative automatically calculates "dx" from X-Array (h is no longer a parameter)
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.12.1.49
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.12.1.49
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 16 Dec 2020 18:58:41 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.12.1]

- Update to Instrument Framework v1.7 (fixes missing LevyLab.lvclass issue)
- Change the way Lockin Engine handles waveform arrays (applies low pass filter to interleved X and Y channels rather than parallel low pass filters)
- Lockin Engine organized into subVIs
- fix Sweep issue
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

- Related, Push Backup to DB has been changed to not keep opening connections every time it runs
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.7.0.95
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.7.0.95
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Wed, 09 Dec 2020 16:04:48 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Knows how to communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a DSC database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Currently provided by National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM), however a cross-platform protocol is developed using 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.7.0]
- Add "Read Instrument" method to Instrument.UI.lvclass. This needs to be called to inject the Instrument.lvclass reference into the UI process
- Remove LevyLab.lvclass and add "Handle Error" overrides to specific processes that need them
- Update Templates with changes outlined above
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Leiden MNK v1.4.0.20

item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Transport v1.4.4.21
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.4.4.21
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 07 Dec 2020 06:18:14 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
Control Experiment.vi provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device, how the lockin is connected to the device, configures the Krohn Hite amplifier (and Pickering switch if you have one), and sets the base path for saving data.

[SweepControl.lvclass]
Sweep Control.vi: Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
Continuous B sweep.vi: For sweeping B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments.
- Lockin vs Vsg (or Vbg) (Lockin_Vsg.vi)
- Lockin vs Time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi (under development)
- IV curves (IV.vi)

Release Notes: [1.4.4]
- Issue #14: Add upload to S3
- Add Open VI feature to Control Experiment.vi
item.dc:creator: Levylab
